intro: Engelhardia mollis, commonly known as the silky hakea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, silvery foliage. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. It is typically found in coastal regions and is well adapted to sandy soils. Engelhardia mollis is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
